resources.string: Tip : Firewall prevents apps from accessing the Internet over Wifi or Mobile data. Since most forms of surveillance require the data to be sent over to a central repository, firewalling them effectively mitigates the threat. \n\nThere\'s a class of apps that require Internet connection all day, and those are usually communication apps like Gmail and messenger apps like WhatsApp. Firewalling them might not be an option, and that\'s why we built content blockers.
Ready to set dns based content blocker.
Content blocker no longer in effect.
RethinkDNS uses accessibility service to detect and firewall background applications. RethinkDNS does not collect or sell any information.
RethinkDNS is the easiest way to monitor app activity, circumvent Internet censorship, and firewall apps on your Android device.
Say hello to a safer, transparent, and secure Android.

string.name: warning_title
string.description: Status indicator text shown in a warning notification.

string.name: notification_content
string.description: Indicates what will happen if the user taps the notification.

string.name: warning_channel_name
string.description: This is the name of the class of notifications that show warnings. It's only visible in the system's advanced notifications settings page.

string.name: warning_channel_description
string.description: This is the explanatory text describing the 'Warning' notification class. It's only visible in the system's advanced notifications settings page.

resources.string: Shown when RethinkDNS has encountered a problem.

string.name: notification_title
string.description: Status indicator text shown in a persistent notification.

resources.string: Protected! Connected to Fast and Secure DNS.
Protected! Connected to Fast and Secure DNS.

string.name: status_waiting
string.description: This text appears during the connection process if Intra needs user permission or the phone is offline.

string.name: status_failing
string.description: This text appears if the connection is currently not working correctly. [CHAR_LIMIT=NONE]

string.name: explanation_offline
string.description: Status indicator shown when there is no network connection.

resources.string: Your device is offline. Intra is waiting for a network connection.

string.name: explanation_vpn
string.description: Warning text shown on the main screen before the user starts Intra

resources.string: RethinkDNS has detected another VPN on your device. If you enable Rethink, that VPN will be disabled. RethinkDNS is not as secure as a trusted VPN.
Warning: Queries are failing. You may want to choose a different server or restart Intra.

string.name: status_starting
string.description: This text briefly appears while starting.

string.name: explanation_starting
string.description: Corresponds to status_starting

resources.string: Hang tight. Intra is establishing a server connection.

string.name: status_protected
string.description: This is a large message in a reassuring color. It indicates that DNS queries can't be surveilled or modified in transit.

string.name: explanation_protected
string.description: Expanded form of status_protected

resources.string: Your connection is protected from DNS attacks.

string.name: explanation_upgraded
string.description: Corresponds to status_upgraded.

resources.string: Your connection is currently protected by Android Private DNS, but an attacker could disable or undermine this protection.

string.name: status_strict
string.description: This is similar to dns_on, but the protection is being provided by the operating system, not by Rethink. It is not color-highlighted.

string.name: explanation_strict
string.description: Explanation on the main screen for users who have Private DNS strict mode enabled at the OS level.

resources.string: RethinkDNS has detected that the Android Private DNS setting is enabled. This means your DNS queries are already protected, so there\'s no need to enable Rethink.

string.name: status_exposed
string.description: This is a large message in a scary color. It indicates that DNS queries can be surveilled or modified in transit.

string.name: explanation_exposed
string.description: Expanded form of status_exposed

resources.string: Your connection is exposed to DNS attacks.

string.name: dns_explanation_connected
string.description: The message will be shown when the DNS is connected

string.name: dns_explanation_disconnected
string.description: This message will be shown to user in main screen when the DNS is not connected

string.name: firewall_explanation_text
string.description: Explanation on the main screen for the users about what the firewall does.

resources.string: Block apps or a category of apps from connecting to the Internet in response to device events: Limiting access to the Internet helps prevent unwarranted data usage as well as conserves battery.

string.name: app_mgr_explanation_text
string.description: Explanation on the main screen for the users about what the application manager does.

resources.string: Check which apps consume your data. Streamline your Android smartphone or tablet. Quickly and easily uninstall multiple unwanted applications.

string.name: network_queries_explanation_text
string.description: Explanation on the main screen for the users about network queries

resources.string: View DNS queries this device has requested. Typically, one request is sent for each Internet connection established by any app: For example, loading a web page can result in tens of DNS queries.

string.name: settings_connection_tracker_explanation_text
string.description: Explanation on the main screen about connection tracking screen

resources.string: Keep tabs on incoming and outgoing Internet traffic. RethinkDNS firewall when enabled keeps track of connections an app makes to various endpoints on the Internet.

string.name: settings_explanation_text
string.description: Explanation on the main screen for the users for settings screen.

resources.string: Block apps from connecting to the Internet. Limiting access to the Internet helps prevent unwarranted data usage, as well as conserve battery.
Apply firewall rules on all applications based on device events, for example, firewall when the device is locked or when a particular app is not in use.
Whitelisted applications are exempt from all firewall rules.
All connections to these IPs are blocked for all apps except the ones in the whitelist.

» Circumvent Internet censorship.
» Prevent DNS manipulation attacks with encrypted DNS.
» First line of defence against malware and other security threats.
» Monitor DNS traffic.
\u00BB Firewall select apps from connecting to the Internet.\n\u00BB Monitor network activity of all apps.\n\u00BB Note: This feature may consume extra battery.
RethinkDNS uses accessibility service to track which apps are in-use (foreground) versus those that are not in-use (background).
Start Firewall / DNS+Firewall to configure apps.
Start DNS / DNS+Firewall to view logs
Start Firewall / DNS+Firewall to configure Firewall.
Start DNS / DNS+Firewall to configure DNS.
Start Firewall / DNS+Firewall to view network logs.
Does not block any DNS requests. Uses Cloudflare\'s 1.1.1.1 DNS endpoint.
Blocks malware and adult content. Uses Cloudflare\'s 1.1.1.3 DNS endpoint.
Blocks malicious content. Uses Cloudflare\'s 1.1.1.2 DNS endpoint.
Blocks malware and more. Uses RethinkDNS\'s non-configurable basic endpoint.
Set your own custom DNS-over-HTTPS endpoint.
Configurable DNS endpoint: Provides in-depth analytics of your Internet traffic, allows you to set custom rules and more.
RethinkDNS is the easiest way to monitor app activity, circumvent Internet censorship, and firewall apps on your Android device.
RethinkDNS is a free and open-source project, led by ex-engineers from Amazon, IBM, and Scientific Games.
to report bugs and suggest features.
Join the RethinkDNS group on Telegram
RethinkDNS is part of Mozilla Builders MVP program.
This only deletes network logs but not firewall rules. This operation is not reversible. Do you want to proceed?
This deletes all the DNS logs. This operation is not reversible. Do you want to proceed?
Block <u>all apps</u> from connecting to <u>this IP</u>
Block <u>this app</u> from connecting to this IP
Block <u>this app</u> from connecting to the Internet

» <u>Rule #1</u>: Blocks an app from connecting to the Internet. 
 » <u>Rule #2</u>: Blocks any app from connecting to a particular IP. 
 » <u>Rule #3</u>: Blocks all connections when device locked (Universal Firewall). 
 » <u>Rule #4</u>: Blocks any app not in use (Universal Firewall). 
 » <u>Rule #5</u>: Blocks connections when source app unknown (Universal Firewall). 
 » <u>Rule #6</u>: Blocks all UDP traffic except DNS (Universal Firewall).
Block connections when source app is unknown
All rules related to this app will be cleared
All rules related to this app is cleared
"Private DNS" is on in Android network settings
\"Always-On VPN\" is enabled on this device. To start RethinkDNS, please go to Settings app and disable \"Always-on VPN\".
Allow requesting apps to bypass RethinkDNS firewall on-demand. Some audio/video conference apps like Zoom and WhatsApp may require an on-demand bypass to function properly.
"Disabled. Settings->VPN->Block connections without VPN" is enabled for RethinkDNS, enabling the feature will block the internet connection of the apps which are trying to bypass the VPN.
Some system apps are critical to proper functioning of a device. Block them only if you know what you are doing.
Some system components are critical to proper functioning of a device. Block them only if you know what you are doing.
Deleting this rule would allow any app to connect to this IP. Do you want to proceed?
No IPs blocked. Tap on entries in the "Network Log" screen to block individual IP addresses.
Deleting these rules would allow any application to connect to the currently blocked IPs.
Delete the DNS over Https endpoint from saved configuration.
Delete the DNSCrypt resolver from saved configuration.
Delete the DNSCrypt relay from saved configuration.
Delete the DNS Proxy from saved configuration.
Choose from 170+ blocklists to configure RethinkDNS Plus.
Download blocklists (around 40MB) to use this feature?
Currently, %1$s blocklist(s) in-use. No additional blocklists have been set. Do you want to quit anyway?
No change in the current configuration. Do you want to quit anyway?
Something went wrong. Please try again later.
Set up a DNS Proxy by clicking on the ADD button below.

string-array.name: dns_crypt_endpoint_desc
string-array.item: Blocks access to all adult, pornographic and explicit sites. It also blocks proxy and VPN domains that are used to bypass the filters. Mixed content sites (like Reddit) are also blocked. Google, Bing and Youtube are set to the Safe Mode.
Protects your device from malware and more.
Adguard DNS with safe-search and adult content blocking.
Block access to phishing, malware, and malicious domains. It does not block adult content.

string-array.name: dns_crypt_relay_endpoint_desc
string-array.item: Anonymized DNS relay hosted in Netherlands.
Anonymized DNS relay hosted in Paris, France provided by https://cryptostorm.is/.
Anonymized DNS relay hosted in Stockholm, Sweden provided by https://cryptostorm.is/.
Anonymized DNS relay hosted in US - Los Angeles, CA provided by https://cryptostorm.is/.
Anonymized DNS relay hosted in Singapore.

resources.string: Logs not captured when connected to DNS Proxy.
HTTP(S) Proxy settings are only a hint to applications but they may or may not use it; however, browsers like Chrome and Firefox do use these.
Block all UDP traffic except DNS
A version of the app is available for download from the website. Do you want to proceed?
You are already on the latest version.
Either our servers are down or connection could not be established. Please try again after sometime.

DNS:

 » Support for RethinkDNS+ (a configurable DNS resolver with custom blocklists) deployed to 200+ locations world-wide.
 » Support for DNSCrypt v2 with Anonymized Relays.
 » Support to forward DNS requests to other apps like Nebulo or PDNSF.

 Firewall:

 » Support for "Always-on VPN" and "Block connections without VPN" (this is enforced by Android and is full-proof in that it blocks all internet traffic that bypasses VPN ensuring nothing escapes the RethinkDNS firewall).
 » Exclude apps from VPN, that is from the RethinkDNS firewall altogether.
 » Whitelist apps from RethinkDNS firewall rules (but not DNS).
 » Block all connections when source app is unknown (this occasionally happens with UDP traffic that the source app cannot be determined at times).
 » Block all UDP traffic except DNS traffic.
 » Block IP addresses apps are connecting to individually from the "Network Log" screen.

 UI:

 » DNS Firewall screens see a major UI overhaul.
 » A bottom sheet in "Network Log" now shows some relevant actions (block app, block IP, kill app).
 » A tap on DNS logs entries now shows more information including blocklists.
 » Select and copy app names and IP addresses from both "DNS Logs" screen and "Network Logs".
 » A search bar in all firewall screens.

 Proxies:

 » Forward TCP connections to any SOCKS5 endpoint.
 » Set a HTTP/S proxy endpoint.
